result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Thomas Stuart Palmer Jr.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Thomas Stuart Palmer Jr. in court.  Attorney Lauren Stuckert in court for Thomas Stuart Palmer Jr.  Attorney Michael R Staskunas in court for State of Wisconsin. Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Defense is requesting a status conference. Case is adjourned in Branch 36.
Status conference scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Thomas Stuart Palmer Jr. appeared by video.  Attorney Lauren Stuckert appeared by video for Thomas Stuart Palmer Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Judge Crivello, Branch 36.  Original Information filed. Defense Counsel requests an Arraignment.  Court ordered case adjourned to Branch 36.
Arraignment scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire & Waiver

Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY. 
No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Thomas Stuart Palmer Jr. in court.  Attorney Lauren Stuckert in court for Thomas Stuart Palmer Jr. Prosecuting attorney Foley J. Van Lieshout Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Crivello, Branch 36. Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 9/7/22 @ 1p
